A mathematical model describing the relationship between input x(t) and output y(t).
y(t) = T{x(t)}

Output at time t depends ONLY on input at time t.
Example: y(t) = 2x(t)

Output at t depends only on input at t or earlier (past).
No dependence on future inputs.

Bounded Input → Bounded Output
|x(t)| ≤ Mₓ ⇒ |y(t)| ≤ Mᵧ
for all time t

Zero input test fails:
T{0} = 0 + 3 = 3 ≠ 0
Linear systems must give zero output for zero input.

Linear Time-Invariant system.
Has BOTH linearity and time-invariance.
Characterized by impulse response h(t).

1. Completely characterized by impulse response h(t)
2. Output = convolution of input with h(t)
3. Frequency response analysis possible
4. Most analysis tools designed for LTI
